title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a personal project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to help users track and manage their sleep debt.  This repository provides a functional sleep tracking application and serves as a showcase for applying TypeScript in a practical web development project. It focuses on providing a simple and intuitive user interface for monitoring sleep patterns and understanding sleep debt accumulation.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to implement a robust and user-friendly voting system. This repository contains the codebase for a modern voting application, focusing on providing a clean user interface and secure backend logic for various voting scenarios, making it a valuable resource for learning or adapting to specific project needs.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project-based repository showcasing a modern web dashboard built with Next.js, leveraging TypeScript for enhanced type safety and CSS/JavaScript for styling and dynamic functionality. It serves as a learning resource and template for developing data-driven dashboards with a focus on clean architecture and efficient UI/UX.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project focused on creating interactive map visualizations using HTML and Python. This repository contains the code and resources to generate dynamic maps, explore geographical data, and present spatial information in a user-friendly format. It serves as a practical example of integrating web development and data visualization techniques.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a web application designed to facilitate collaborative brainstorming and project planning. Built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, this interactive idea board allows users to visually organize and prioritize project ideas, fostering a dynamic and efficient environment for team collaboration. It focuses on providing a user-friendly experience for managing and developing new projects.

title: jovian
description: The jovian repository hosts a CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) application built using Python and Flask, leveraging PostgreSQL for database management. This project demonstrates practical application development skills, incorporating HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting alongside Python for a full-stack implementation. It serves as a comprehensive example of a Python-based web application, encompassing key topics such as database interaction, server-side logic, and front-end presentation.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for monitoring and controlling Robofleet robots. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, this project facilitates real-time data visualization and interaction with robotic systems, enabling efficient robot management and performance analysis. It's a core project focused on providing a user-friendly dashboard experience.

title: resume
description: This repository contains my resume, typeset using LaTeX. It serves as a project to showcase document preparation skills and provides a readily accessible version of my professional qualifications and experience. The project utilizes TeX for formatting and organization, demonstrating proficiency in this language for creating professional-looking documents.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project leveraging TypeScript, Vite.js, Express.js, and the Gemini API to build a user-friendly application. This repository houses the codebase for the project, showcasing the integration of these technologies for a practical application with frontend components built using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript and backend logic powered by Node.js.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebooks and Python, contains a collection of projects focused on applying Python to various financial topics. It serves as a practical learning resource for individuals interested in exploring financial analysis, modeling, and data visualization using Python's powerful ecosystem.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a Next.js project built with TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, and Supabase, designed for tracking IoT assets. This application leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly interface for managing and monitoring the location and status of connected devices.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a JavaScript-based project that creates a responsive and interactive event calendar using HTML and CSS for its front-end structure and styling. This repository showcases a practical application of front-end web development principles and provides a customizable solution for displaying events in a user-friendly and visually appealing manner.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool designed to visualize and analyze log data generated by ROS (Robot Operating System) applications. Built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting, it provides a user-friendly interface for filtering, searching, and interpreting ROS logs, facilitating easier debugging and performance analysis within robotics projects.
